before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1tki8","text":"Always wear proper Personal Protective Equipment and work in a fume hood when working with hexanes, hydrochloric acid, MTBE, diazomethane, polychlorinated biphenyl (PCBs) and their derivatives, and strong acids and bases. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vpvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f5g8","text":"Note that this protocol involves work with experimental animals and requires prior approval by the users' Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) or equivalent ethics committee.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6ahle","text":"This protocol describes a method to extract PCB11 (3,3'-dichlorobiphenyl) and its monohydoxylated metabolites from mouse tissues via a liquid-liquid extraction followed by solid-phase extraction clean-up. The level of PCB11 and OH-PCB11s in the tissue are subsequently measured by gas chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"fn98f","text":"The responsible Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC) approved the animal protocol used to generate tissue samples. All animals were utilized in accordance with all Public Health Service (PHS) policies and the Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals, National Institutes of Health (NIH) Publication No. 85-23, revised 2010.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

well.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cnohi","text":"9:1 Hexane: diethyl ether (v/v): 90 mL of hexane and 10 mL of diethyl ether were measured with graduated cylinder, and mixed well in amber bottle with cap. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsuft","text":"1% KCl (w/w): 5 g KCl was dissolved in 500 mL of Milli-q water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0hej","text":"6 M HCl: Add 50 mL of HCl (12M) to a volumetric flask (100 mL), then add Milli-Q water to the marking.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8srl8","text":"0.1 M phosphoric acid in 0.9% NaCl solution: Add 0.9 g of NaCl and 1.15 g of 85% phosphoric acid to a volumetric flask (100 mL) and then add Milli-Q water to the marking.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9gemv","text":"Acidified silica gel: The silica gel in a beaker was combusted at 450 °C for overnight. After cooling down, the sigical gel was transfer to a screw-capped glass bottle. The mixture of combusted silica gel and sulfuric acid by weight ratio of 5 : 1 (For example, 40 g of silica gel was mixed with 8 g of sulfuric acid) was shaked vigorously until no lumps were observed. The acidified silica gel was kept in another screw-capped glass bottle and ready for the SPE cartridge. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"364kc","text":"1 M KOH in 95% EtOH: add 2.8 g (0.1 mol) of KOH to a clean beaker (100 mL), then add 2.5 mL of Milli-Q water. Stir the mixture until KOH is dissolved completely, then add 47.5 mL EtOH and get the solution mixed well before using. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ndd6","text":"Place tissues (liver 100-200 mg, brain 200 mg, adipose 50-80 mg) in tube-A. Record weight on the working sheet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gk5a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l9t8","text":"Note: Wash scalpel, forceps, and spatula between samples with water, acetone, and hexane subsequently.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":102},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23v97","text":"Spike all tube-A samples (MB, TB, tissue, OPR, and Reference standard) with SS_PCB (10 ng d-PCB65 and 10 ng PCB14). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ear3q","text":" d-PCB65, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":16,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcpdh","text":" PCB14, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etd88","text":"Invert tube-A on the tube rotator and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bke64","text":"Add 5 drops of methanol to tube-C all the samples except Reference standard and vortex for 5 s.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"13fpm","text":"Add 3 mL of hexane with a repeater pipettor and vortex.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2etvv","text":"Spike 100 µL of IS (PCB30+PCB204, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each) to each tube-E and the Reference standard using a single channel pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"da69g","text":"Recap the samples after the GC-MS/MS or GC-ECD analysis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cac8d","text":"Add 3 mL of 2-propanol to all tube-A samples with repeater pipettor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":29,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"esemp","text":"Homogenize the sample (~30-60 s).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rt90","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mp4q","text":"Note: Rinse the TissueRuptor blade between samples with water in a beaker, followed by 2-propanol (~ 5 mL in a test tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":122},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1qi3d","text":"Add 1 mL of diethyl ether with a repeater pipettor in a fume hood to each sample, recap, and vortex gently. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e6fsq","text":"Spike all tube-A samples (MB, TB, tissue, OPR, and Reference standard) with SS_OH-PCB (10 ng 4’-OH-PCB159). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"77vlf","text":" 4’-OH-PCB159, 100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ep02","text":"Spike the following analytes only to tube-A OPR samples and the tube for the Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ermlo","text":"100 µL of PCB11 standard (100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bnvml","text":"100 µL of OH-PCB11 standard mixture (100 µL x 100 ng/mL = 10 ng each)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":43,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej61m","text":"Cap tube-A and the Reference standard.     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":19,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"380vu","text":"Add 5 mL of phosphoric acid (H3PO4) in NaCl with repeater pipettor to tube-B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":30,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":33,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45b09","text":"Adding 1 mL of 2-propanol and 3 mL of hexane-diethyl ether (9:1) to tube-A with a repeater pipettor, vortex for 10 secs, and centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f5he","text":"Transfer the supernatant from tube-A to tube-B.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3s8rs","text":"Transfer the organic layer (top layer) to a new tube-C with new long pipettes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4f6co","text":"Re-extract tube-B with 3 mL of hexane-diethyl ether (9:1), vortex, and centrifuge","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afh31","text":"Evaporate solvent in tube-C under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~100 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":21,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ujug","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45s77","text":"Note: Do not evaporate to dryness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj05m","text":"In the fume hood, using a 10 mL serological pipette, add ~0.5 mL of diazomethane to each sample and 1 mL to the Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":112,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9lm33","text":"Cap the tubes and keep them in a solvent-proof refrigerator (NOT freezer) at 4-8 °C for at least 3 h or overnight (approximately 16 h).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":61,"length":11},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":61,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeimu","text":"Evaporate the Reference standard to near dryness (~ 50 μ L) and put it aside for the IS spiking step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":14,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4qkld","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tex_formula","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"formula":"","guid":"","id":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"btdqj","text":"Evaporate the excess of ether and diazomethane in a fume hood under a gentle N2 flow (no yellow color, ~200 µL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avejs","text":"Add 2 mL of KOH-95% EtOH solution with a repeater pipettor and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ols4","text":"Heat for 1 hour in a water bath at 50 °C, vortexing the samples approximately every 15 mins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4sng6","text":"Evaporate the solvent under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~0.5 mL","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rg3h","text":"Add 2 mL of hexane using a repeater pipettor to tube-C and vortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2uis9","text":"Add 7 mL of Mili-Q water with repeater pipettor, invert, and centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"24eh5","text":"Transfer extracts from tube-E and the Reference standard with a long pipette to a combusted crimp-style GC vial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":37,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"kv8p","text":"Concentrate the samples in tube-E under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~200 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rgm7","text":"With long glass pipettes, slowly load the extracts from tube-D into the SPE cartridge and pass it through the cartridge for collection. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":56,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"902t5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e86cj","text":"Notes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lq85","text":"Adjust the vacuum of the manifold accordingly, and let the eluent drip drop by drop. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"33t23","text":"Close off the vacuum once the gel is dry to avoid evaporating the sample liquid.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":75}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vfnc","text":"Always keep the solvent level above silica gel.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1oe8o","text":"Replace the waste tubes at the bottom with freshly labeled, combusted tube-E. Align tube-D order in the tube rack with the order of tube-E.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":83,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fj9o","text":"Quality control samples include:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbqcu","text":"Method blank (MB): x2 or x3 to make sample number even","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"114b9","text":"Tissue blank (TB): tissue from control animals","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5h6nk","text":"Tissue samples: tissue from exposed animals","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s264","text":"Ongoing Precision and Recovery (OPR): tissue blank spiked with surrogate standard (SS), internal standard (IS), and analytes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"quv0","text":"Reference standard: includes SS, IS, and analytes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68mch","text":"Instrument blank or solvent: hexane only","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qppu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"902er","text":"Note: For the spike test, use only blank tissue. For actual tests, use blank tissue plus exposed samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":106},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6g58","text":"Combust silica gel, glass wool, all glassware (cartridges, short and long pipettes, tubes, beaker/volumetric flask, funnel), scalpel, forceps, and spatula.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"di6fg","text":"Print the working sheet (see attachment for an example).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ek2po","text":"Remove the analytical standards for the ORP and the SS from the freezer and allow to warm to room temperature (~ 30 min). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o6eq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8mca7","text":"Label tubes as A1, A2 etc, and Reference standard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bp5uv","text":"Note: For the entire method, all centrifugation steps are for 5 mins at 3000 rpm. Tubes are inverted on the tube rotator for 5 mins at 40 RPM. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":143}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mds3","text":"","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23fes","text":"Note: For the evaporation or “blow down” step with nitrogen, a warm water bath (35 °C) can be used if needed.  ","type":"header-four","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":111}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l7g5","text":"Transfer the supernatant from tube-A to tube-B with a long pipet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akk0s","text":"Transfer the top layer to tube-D with a short pipette. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9v3v","text":"Let samples sit on the lab bench for 15 mins, centrifuge, and transfer the top layer to combine with tube-D (volume ~5 mL). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2piuj","text":"Rinse tube-D twice (2 x 0.5 mL) with hexane:DCM (1:1) and pass through the cartridge each time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7emjg","text":"Turn off the manifold vacuum and remove tube-E from the SPE manifold.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4d4ii","text":"Add 3 mL of hexane to tube-E, then continue to concentrate the sample under a gentle stream of nitrogen to ~50 µL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48sgq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vaum","text":"Note: Do not evaporate to dryness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lqbg","text":"Dispose of all items as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6puu","text":"Scalpel – sharps container ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0ie6","text":"Homogenizer probe – If actual test, dispose in the PCB container. If spike test, dispose in the hazard waste container. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as8dk","text":"SPE Cartridges—Remove the cartridges from the SPE manifold and dispose of all content in the PCB waste container. Place the cartridges in the sink to be washed. Add the original waste tubes to the manifold, open the vacuum tube on the manifold, and turn on the vacuum. Clean the cartridge with acetone and then hexane. Turn off the vacuum and remove it. Let the top dry on its end, and once fully dry, place the manifold back on the shelf. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1unik","text":"Evaporator – Place needles in the beaker to be combusted. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65sme","text":"Tube-A, Tube-B, Tube-C, Tube-D, Tube-E, and other aqueous solutions – Aqueous hazardous waste ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bracp","text":"Organic solvents (waste tubes with hexane and 2-propanol) – Organic hazardous waste ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lvpn","text":"All PCB-exposed disposable glassware, foil, GC vials, and gloves – Blue PCB hazardous waste container. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8idr6","text":"Serological pipette – glass hazard container. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d2va6","text":"Store all samples, including the solvent blank, in a solvent-proof -20°C freezer until the data are published.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8begp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8egog","text":"Note: Do not store samples in a regular -20°C freezer because solvent vapors will destroy the freezer over time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":112},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"285ud","text":"Store samples in solvent-proof -20°C freezer until instrument analysis. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajvl4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhu7h","text":"Note: Do not store samples in a regular -20°C freezer because solvent vapors will destroy the freezer over time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":112},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1f097","text":"Prepare the solvent blank by filling a GC vial with hexane. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80pv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bpgpu","text":"Note: Use the same hexane used for the extractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":51},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"74j4t","text":"Cap all vials immediately with a crimp cap and crimper to seal the cap. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"38hmu","text":"Rinse tube-E with hexane and combine with to the GC vial to give a final volume of ~0.6 mL. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"b9mti","text":"Vortex each tube-E.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q4nd","text":"Label all sample tubes (Tube-A, Tube-B, Tube-C, Tube-D, and Tube-E).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6pk3c","text":"Repeatedly adding hexane:DCM (1:1) mixture (total volume ~ 9 mL) till the eluent in tube-E reaches 10 mL mark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33agt","text":"Make fresh KOH-95% EtOH solution and set it aside for the base cleanup step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4og7m","text":"Remove the IS standards from the freezer and allow to warm to room temperature (~ 30 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"epkhf","text":"Label GC vials.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0bs","text":"Prepare the SPE cartridges.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djut0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fros","text":"Note: The SPE cartridge can also be prepared using the dry reagent loading method: Glass wool is placed on the bottom of the SPE cartridges, and 0.2 g of silica gel and 2 g of acidified silica gel are added. Then, 3 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) mixture is passed through the cartridge to rinse the filled cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":309}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"rg12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10kan","text":"Note: DCM is toxic, need to work in fume hood with good ventilation condition. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":79},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjiu","text":"Add uncombusted tubes to the bottom of the SPE manifold to collect waste eluent from the SPE cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8fmfa","text":"Replace the top and place the clean SPE cartridges into each port.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f72nl","text":"Add glass wool to the SPE cartridge and pack it down with the end of a glass pipet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2r88j","text":"Add 0.2 g of silica gel with a combusted small glass funnel to the SPE cartridges.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akc8f","text":"Add 2 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) with a long pipette to rinse to the SPE cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e2nh3","text":"In a small beaker, mix hexane:DCM (1:1) with acidified silica gel (5:1), swirl, and add the entire suspension with a short pipette on top of the silica gel in each SPE cartridge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6f6fh","text":"Mix the suspension with a short glass pipette tip to eliminate air bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1eklb","text":"Let the silica gel precipitate to the bottom before passing ~ 3 mL of hexane:DCM (1:1) into the bottom waste tube. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffgpf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9q5u8","text":"Note: Always keep the solvent above the acidified silica gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4p56","text":"Invert tube-B for 5 min and centrifuge.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18jsf","text":"Transfer the top layer to combine with the extract in tube-C (~ 7 mL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":54,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etia1","text":"Put the Reference standard aside for the derivatization step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Internal Standard (IS) Spiking IS and preparation for analysis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"47bh7","text":"Use the Excel worksheet included with this protocol to calculate the levels of PCB11 and its hydroxylated metabolites after gas chromatographic analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: DAY 2: BASE CLEANUP, LIPID REMOVAL, AND INTERNAL STANDARD SPIKING
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"deir7","text":"Turn on the water bath with setting of 50 °C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"6srbi","text":"The following section describes precautions for the safe handling of chemicals used in this protocol. Consult the Safety Data Sheet for additional information regarding all chemicals used in this protocol:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqfqh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"api9u","text":"Acetone:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lmt6","text":"Work under hood.
